importantArticles.headline: Julie Hyman and Roundhill Investments CEO Dave Mazza take a closer look at some of the trending tickers of the trading session ahead of the closing bell on Wall Street. The "Magnificent Seven" stocks, made up of Nvidia (NVDA), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), and Apple (AAPL), rise as the tariff relief rally lifts Big Tech stocks. Vertiv Holdings (VRT) stock surges after the data center cooling system company reported a first quarter earnings beat and raised its full-year sales guidance. Solar equipment stocks Enphase Energy (ENPH) and SolarEdge (SEDG) plunge after Guggenheim analysts downgraded the stocks to Sell. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.
importantArticles.title: Mag 7 rallies, Vertiv surges, solar downgraded: Trending Tickers

importantArticles.headline: Nvidia partner Vertiv's (NYSE: VRT) stock rose by as much as 21% in early morning trading as the company's first-quarter earnings report confirmed that there's nothing wrong with demand for data center equipment.  The report contained plenty of positives, and Vertiv continues to offer investors an excellent way to get exposure to AI-led demand for data center capacity.  The two major pluses from the earnings report this morning were the hike in full-year sales guidance and the return to impressive yearly order growth.
importantArticles.title: Here's Why Data Center Equipment Company Vertiv's Stock Soared Today

importantArticles.headline: Brad Smith outlines the top stories on Wall Street as part of Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Vertiv Holdings (VRT) stock is soaring after the company reported first quarter earnings that beat Wall Street estimates and increased its full-year guidance, signaling strong artificial intelligence (AI) demand. The US Department of Justice is looking into Disney's (DIS) deal with fuboTV (FUBO) for possible antitrust concerns. Novavax (NVAX) stock surges after the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) requested COVID vaccine data from the company, which could signal that FDA approval is incoming. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
importantArticles.title: Vertiv earnings beat, DOJ & Disney–fuboTV deal, Novavax COVID shot

importantArticles.headline: Data center products and services company Vertiv (NYSE:VRT) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 24.2% year on year to $2.04 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($2.35 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 3.7% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.64 per share was 3.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
importantArticles.title: Vertiv (NYSE:VRT) Reports Strong Q1, Stock Jumps 18.5%

importantArticles.headline: Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), a global provider of critical digital infrastructure, today announced a groundbreaking collaboration with NVIDIA and renowned AI pioneer iGenius to deploy Colosseum, one of the world's largest NVIDIA DGX AI supercomputers with NVIDIA Grace Blackwell Superchips. Set to deploy in 2025 in Italy, Colosseum will redefine the digital landscape through a first-of-its-kind sovereign AI data center for regulated workloads.

The pullback from Microsoft has created an opportunity for both Google (GOOGL) and Meta (META) to backfill capacity, the firm says. Hyperscale redesigns for higher densities are driving slower DC equip
importantArticles.title: TD Cowen sees slower data center equipment purchasing as negative for Vertiv

The pullback followed comments from President Trump clarifying the scope of his administration's 25% tariffs on Venezuela. importantArticles.headline: Vertiv Holdings  faces near-term challenges as sluggish buying of data-center equipment hurts demand for its cooling systems, TD Cowen and  Barclays  analysts argued Wednesday.  TD Cowen analysts led by Michael Elias pointed to a slowdown in orders for data-center equipment.  The shift began in January and stemmed from hyperscalers like  Microsoft  and  Alphabet  -owned Google redesigning their data centers to cram more power-hungry equipment into each server rack, they said.
importantArticles.title: Vertiv Stock Tumbles. Analysts See Slowing Orders for Data-Center Gear.
